description: Dive into "Romantic Escapes in Enchanting Madrid" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Romantic Escapes in Enchanting Madrid

places.generalDescription: Plaza Mayor, also known as Madrid de Los Austrias, is a historic square in Madrid that served as the center of power for the Habsburgs from 1516 to 1700. The grand plaza features stately arches and a statue of Philip III at its center. It is surrounded by three-story residential buildings and boasts 237 wrought-iron balconies.

sources.snippet: The Plaza Mayor changes at night, creating a magical atmosphere with its lights and historic architecture. Enjoy a romantic stroll and choose an outdoor cafeteria where you can enjoy a dessert or a glass of wine.
sources.shortName: Romance in Madrid: Romantic Places and Activities

places.name: Plaza Mayor

reviews.text:
One of the must-see spots in Madrid! Plaza Mayor is a beautiful and historic square with stunning architecture and a vibrant atmosphere.

Surrounded by charming cafes and restaurants, it's the perfect place to relax, enjoy some tapas, and soak in the local vibe.

Whether you visit during the day or in the evening, the plaza has a unique charm that captures the spirit of Madrid.

A great place for photos, people-watching, and starting your walking tour through the heart of the city!

Plaza Mayor is a must-visit landmark! This historic square in the heart of Madrid is simply breathtaking. Surrounded by beautiful architecture, it truly captures the essence of the city's rich history and culture. The square is vibrant and lively, with plenty of cafes and shops to explore. It's a perfect spot to sit back, relax, and soak in the atmosphere. Whether you're enjoying a coffee, taking meals or just moving around , Plaza Mayor offers a delightful experience for everyone. Highly recommended for anyone visiting Madrid!

Beautiful square in the heart of Madrid. The architecture is impressive and the place has a great atmosphere with lots of cafes and restaurants around. It can be busy with tourists, but it's a nice spot to sit, enjoy a coffee, and watch the life of the city. A must-visit when in Madrid.

places.address: Pl. Mayor, Centro, 28012 Madrid, Spain

places.generalDescription: El Retiro Park, one of the largest parks in Madrid, was previously owned by the Spanish Monarchy. This 19th-century park features a boating lake, rose garden, numerous fountains, and statues.

sources.snippet: Rowing a boat on the lake at the Retiro Park on a sunny day will be a bonding experience, followed by a walk through the Palacio de Cristal, a building made entirely of glass. Or, for just a couple euros, visit Madrid‚Äôs Botanical Gardens, which are especially lovely in spring, as the blooming lilies and tulips seem to stretch on for miles. The bonsai tree garden is a quirky exhibit that you can visit during any season to see different bonsai trees from around the world.
sources.shortName: A Romantic Couple‚Äôs Guide To Madrid

sources.snippet: If you‚Äôre the kind of couple that likes to go skating, Retiro Park is the place for you. The Paseo de Coches, the park‚Äôs main promenade, has been a paradise for skaters for two centuries. In the surrounding area you‚Äôll find places to rent skates, where they even organise guided skating routes through Madrid.
sources.shortName: Things to do in Madrid for couples

sources.snippet: A boat ride across the pond in El Retiro Park may sound great, but there are lots of more innovative things to do in Madrid. A different stay in the Spanish capital with your significant other.
sources.shortName: Unique romantic getaways | Official tourism website

sources.snippet: Retiro Park: Rent a rowboat on the lake for a classic romantic experience, especially during sunset hours. The Crystal Palace and Rose Garden provide perfect spots for intimate moments.
sources.shortName: Romantic Things to do in Madrid: Top Experiences for Couples

sources.snippet: Spanning nearly 350 acres, Retiro Park is among the city's largest green spaces. Originally designed as a retreat for royalty, it opened to the public in the late 19th century.
sources.shortName: The 9 Most Romantic Things to Do in Madrid

sources.snippet: Ideal for those who want to have a picnic or even take a boat trip on the park's lake while enjoying the beautiful natural scenery.
sources.siteName: Living Tours - Tours and Activities in Portugal and Spain
sources.shortName: Romantic things to do in Madrid for Couples, 2024

sources.snippet: In this blog post, we‚Äôll introduce you to some of the most romantic things to do in the Spanish capital. So, listo para el amor?.
sources.shortName: Romantic Things To Do In Madrid
Romantic Things to Do for Valentine‚Äôs Day in Madrid

places.name: El Retiro Park

reviews.text: I visited El Retiro Park park on the 13th of July. This was my second visit to the park. I first visited this park in December 2024. I experienced the beauty of this park in winter as well as during the summer. This is truly a beautiful park, a calm escape from the bustling city. The sculpture gardens, the rose garden, the great pond is all worth visiting when in this park. Feeding the ducks and turtles in the pond was so amazing. The entire park filled with its greenery is beyond imagination. The most amazing part is that this park was opened to public in 1868 and until this day, the beauty of this park has remained intact! Such a well-maintained park, giving you a feeling of ease, comfort and happiness. I missed boating in December but made it a point to rent a boat for boating this time when I was there. Such an amazing experience to row a boat on your own. It is a great place for families and friends to meet up and have a quiet picnic there with their loved ones. I highly recommend visiting this park when in Madrid!

Scenic üòç | üòå Peaceful

As already 200K comments are saying it : this place is unique, nested in the heart of the vibrant Madrid, it feels hided in the city.

Big forest, wonderful lake, wildlife and architecture : a cocktail that makes your day! ‚òÄÔ∏è

Of course taking the boat was the summit of the day it's a calm and unique experience but don't hesitate to spend hours in the park it worth it üëãüèº

Slow life, savor & enjoy üòâ

Very beautiful and relaxing. It's a big park with bars and coffee shops. Clean and quiet.
You can rent a kart,bike‚Ä¶etc and walk around the park. The store to rent is outside the park on the corner of the big entrance. Not expensive. I recommend to visit the park it's very nice. You can rent a boat inside the park 6‚Ç¨ normal day and 8‚Ç¨ on weekends.

places.address: Retiro, 28009 Madrid, Spain

places.generalDescription: The Santiago Bernab√©u Stadium is a must-visit for football enthusiasts and Real Madrid supporters. With an 81,000-seat capacity, it has been the home ground for legendary players like Cristiano Ronaldo, Zinedine Zidane, and many more. Visitors can take self-guided tours that offer panoramic views of the stadium, access to the presidential box, press room, dressing rooms, players tunnel, and even the pitch. The tour culminates in the impressive trophy exhibit.

sources.snippet: Alternatively, you can take part in more dynamic activities such as a flamenco show, a soccer match at the famous Santiago Bernab√©u stadium or a tennis tournament at the local competitions.
sources.shortName: What to do as a couple in Madrid ? Top things to do as a couple

places.name: Bernab√©u

reviews.text:
The newly renovated Bernabeu is a state of the art stadium, easily the best that I've been to (other than the Emirates, Highbury, and Kiryat Eliezer).
I sat in the 200s tier slightly off-center. The whole pitch was easily visible. There were individual screens along the ceiling and the stand was covered and heated. The atmosphere was phenomenal because Real closed the roof to help make more noise, but after Saka and Martinelli made the remontada more like a remont-nada, the closed roof only amplified the singing of the Gunners fans and the crying from Los Blancos.

Bragging aside, Real Madrid is the most successful club in the world and this is an adequate home to host the team and the fans. Beautifully designed. Clean. Way to access. Comfortable. Loud and proud!
It's walkable from the city center (about an hour walking from Sol) and easily  reachable by metro.
If you can't watch a game, make sure to visit for a tour. It's iconic!

Simply breathtaking. We went on a guided tour. The experienced lady guided us and explained everything about the stadium. It's worth going with a guide to learn about the history and highlights of the place. Highly recommended. What I liked most was the punctuality. Don't dare come late because you'll be left out.

Amazing futuristic stadium, wow! What an avenue.
Very much modern, massive and well organized. I watched Arsenal and Real Madrid match.

The entry and exit of the stadium is very much streamlined, you believe it's an 80,000 seats stadium. Food and beverage is available, restrooms are super clean. The stadium is heated on the sealing which mostly covered. The screens are available everywhere.

The stadium is a bit too vertical so the seating space is not very comfortable but it's a football stadium so it's ok.

places.address: Av. de Concha Espina, 1, Chamart√≠n, 28036 Madrid, Spain

places.generalDescription: The Thyssen-Bornemisza National Museum in Madrid is a must-visit for art enthusiasts, offering a diverse collection of European masterpieces spanning from the 13th to the 20th century. This museum showcases an extraordinary private collection featuring works by renowned artists such as Titian, Tintoretto, Warhol, and Pollock.

sources.snippet: Other examples of museums not to be missed in Madrid are: the Thyssen-Bornemisza Museum, the Reina Sof√≠a National Art Center Museum, the Sorolla Museum, among other fascinating art spaces.
sources.siteName: Living Tours - Tours and Activities in Portugal and Spain
sources.shortName: Romantic things to do in Madrid for Couples, 2024

places.name: Thyssen-Bornemisza National Museum

reviews.text: I go to museums in every big city I visit so in Madrid, I did the big three - the Reina Sofia, Prado and this one. Of the three, this is my favorite. It's a nice size, with a great and eclectic collection and every piece is interesting. There was also a special exhibit on Miranda Vargas which I liked a lot. There's a great cafe on site and we were lucky to have a sunny day so sat outside. Overall, a great way to spend an afternoon!

Very nice and interesting Art Museum. The artwork is well organized thematically and chronologically within the rooms and is accompanied by informative commentary.
The path through the exhibition is well marked and follows a logical/chronological order, flowing organically from beginning to end.
Very original and well thought the temporary exhibition on "Proust and the Arts".
No queue at the entrance.
Much better experience and service than Prado.
Greatly recommended.

A truly beautiful and world class collection. Well organized and displayed. My issue is that there is very little context for each work. Very few paintings have a description in the audio tour, and are not described beyond artist and date on the wall label. For such prominent works and artists, I would have appreciated more information.

places.address: P.¬∫ del Prado, 8, Centro, 28014 Madrid, Spain

places.generalDescription: Palacio de Cristal, also known as the Crystal Palace, is a must-see attraction located in the heart of Retiro Park in Madrid. This iconic and photogenic spot was inspired by London's Crystal Palace and is a stunning conservatory made entirely of glass. Built in 1887, it was originally designed to showcase native plants and objects from the Philippines during Spain's colonial period.

sources.snippet: Rowing a boat on the lake at the Retiro Park on a sunny day will be a bonding experience, followed by a walk through the Palacio de Cristal, a building made entirely of glass. Or, for just a couple euros, visit Madrid‚Äôs Botanical Gardens, which are especially lovely in spring, as the blooming lilies and tulips seem to stretch on for miles. The bonsai tree garden is a quirky exhibit that you can visit during any season to see different bonsai trees from around the world.
sources.shortName: A Romantic Couple‚Äôs Guide To Madrid

sources.snippet: You'll also want to see the park's Victorian-style Palacio de Cristal. Built in 1887 to serve as a greenhouse, it's a magnificent glass-and-cast-iron structure now used to host temporary art exhibits.
sources.shortName: The 9 Most Romantic Things to Do in Madrid
Best romantic places in Madrid

places.name: Palacio de Cristal

reviews.text:
Parque del Retiro in Madrid is an urban oasis that blends natural beauty with cultural richness. One of the park's highlights is the stunning Palacio de Cristal, a beautiful glass and iron pavilion that looks absolutely breathtaking when sunlight pours through its transparent walls. Originally built in 1887 to exhibit exotic plants from the Philippines, today it serves as an exhibition space for contemporary art.

Walking through the park, you can feel the tranquility amidst the bustling city. Locals and tourists alike come here to relax, picnic, or simply enjoy the lush surroundings. The lake nearby offers boating opportunities, and the statues and monuments scattered throughout add a touch of history and elegance.

Whether you are looking for a quiet retreat or a cultural exploration, Parque del Retiro has something to offer. The combination of nature and architectural beauty makes it a must-visit in Madrid.

Such a stunning place in the middle of the park, the architecture is so beautiful and the light inside of it so intelligent built, as a interior designer I was speechless by the beauty and it was like a magical place in the beautiful retiro park!
There are a lot of people so if you want to take a good photo it's not so easy though, maybe you should go really early!
Nice parc and beautiful overview over the river. Recomemnded to make a walk over the aprk and enjoy the peacocks, they are running free!!

places.address: P.¬∫ de Cuba, 4, Retiro, 28009 Madrid, Spain

places.generalDescription: The Royal Palace of Madrid, an 18th-century ridge-top palace, is a must-visit for its grandeur and historical significance. While it's still the official residence of Spain's royal family, it's more about exploring the palace's history and the country than catching a glimpse of royalty. With over 3,000 rooms including the Royal Kitchen, Royal Armory, Painting Gallery, and a Hall of Mirrors reminiscent of Versailles, there's plenty to explore inside.

sources.snippet: And if you love all things retro, head to the Teatro Real opera house, which is also home to the restaurant Papagena offering impressive views of the Plaza de Oriente and the Royal Palace; the National Archaeological Museum, which has been renovated recently; or the lesser-known yet equally amazing National Museum of Anthropology. You can also stop off at the Mirador de la Cornisa Viewpoint at the Royal Palace to take a beautiful photo of the stunning views over Campo del Moro Park and Casa de Campo Park.
sources.shortName: Unique romantic getaways | Official tourism website

sources.snippet: The official residence of the Spanish monarchy, this iteration of the royal palace opened in 1755 and contains 3,418 rooms. Treasures on display include paintings by Vel√°zquez and Goya, collections of everything from furniture to watches, and the priceless instruments from the world's only Stradivarius string quartet.
sources.shortName: The 9 Most Romantic Things to Do in Madrid

sources.snippet: Madrid is famous for its stunning gardens, which offer a tranquil and romantic escape from the hustle and bustle of the city. El Retiro Park, located in the heart of Madrid, is a must-visit for couples.
sources.shortName: Romantic Things To Do In Madrid

sources.snippet: There are also other natural spaces that are worth visiting with your partner, such as the Sabatini Gardens, Campo del Moro, Capricho Park, the Royal Palace Gardens, among other fascinating places.
sources.siteName: Living Tours - Tours and Activities in Portugal and Spain
sources.shortName: Romantic things to do in Madrid for Couples, 2024
Romantic Things to do in Madrid: Top Experiences for Couples

places.name: Royal Palace of Madrid

reviews.text:
We arrived early in the morning and were among the first visitors - absolutely worth it. No crowds, no rush. The whole experience felt calm and enjoyable.

The palace itself is stunning - rich interiors, impressive halls, and beautiful details everywhere. It doesn't take forever to walk through, but it definitely leaves a strong impression. You feel the history, the scale, and the elegance without being overwhelmed or exhausted.

Highly recommend coming early - it makes all the difference.

Experience European Royalty at it's peak in Royal Palace of Madrid! It was enchanting to see how the name and decorative matched. The color of walls or wallpaper was in sync with fabrics on sofas, curtains, and even carpet on floor.
Very beautiful paintings on ceilings too!
Great Luxury to witness!!

Keep sufficient time when you visit the Palace and choose a cooler time to go.

August might be very hot.

Oh what a fabulous place.  So central. Was here to see changing of the Guard.  Special. Gardens amazing.  And you can walk around 3 sides and capture some fabulous views of the City. Yes a special place.

places.address: Centro, 28071 Madrid, Spain

places.generalDescription: The Museo Nacional Centro de Arte Reina Sof√≠a is a vast museum showcasing an impressive collection of Spanish 20th-century art, featuring renowned works by artists such as Gris, Dali, Picasso, and Miro. Located near the Atocha train station in Madrid, the museum offers free admission during specific hours on weekdays and weekends.

sources.snippet: See the work of more modern Spanish masters at Reina Sofia Museum, which displays Picasso's Guernica and paintings by Salvador Dal√≠. Or explore one of Madrid's smaller museums such as Sorolla (one artist's loving tribute to his wife) along with the museums of Romanticism and Decorative Arts.
sources.shortName: The 9 Most Romantic Things to Do in Madrid
22 Most Romantic Things to do in Madrid [2024]

places.name: Museo Nacional Centro de Arte Reina Sof√≠a

reviews.text:
Truly, truly world class. The exterior of the building was incredible and very imposing. Unique architectural concept.

Upon walking inside, you are immediately confronted with the modern and contemporary art section. These sections were wonderful and it is very interesting for a museum to have both classical and modern / contemporary artworks all in one building. The film installations were quite bizarre to say the least (in a good way), but told an interesting story that I liked.

However, once you ascend up the staircases, you get to enjoy all the art before the modern and contemporary.

My favorite section was about an artist called Nestor de la Torre, an artist from the Canary Islands I did not know about before. His paintings spanned many large rooms, and they were all incredible. The Re√≠na Sof√≠a did a great job on exhibiting many of this little-known artist's works. I must say that his paintings have a quality that upon viewing, you know immediately it is this artist's style. Truly unique, one of a kind. I do not know why he is not represented more in the art scene of today.

Of course, there are the other very famous rooms, which display works by Picasso and Dal√≠. The singular most infamous work on display is Picasso's Guernica, which tells the suffering of war. Some of Dal√≠'s most famous paintings are there as well

I recommend checking out the sketches that Picasso made of the weeping ladies he has displayed in Guernica to get a clear sense of the level of preparation that Picasso did.

Overall, a fantastic museum and great experience. I think this museum - in my opinion - has one of the most intriguing collections of modern art I have seen thus far in all my travels to world class museums. üñºÔ∏è

Please go here if you are in Madrid. The Re√≠na Sof√≠a also has a wonderful, amazing store filled with so many great books that I wanted to take back with me! üòä

We happened to walk across the neighborhood, and my wife said that after their official ticket time that around 7 pm, then there is a free entry before they close at 9 pm. I suppose this is only on weekends. I'm not sure on weekdays. So we decided to take the opportunity and we waited in line ( not that long and good thing everybody seated yet in line along those short walls in front of entrance).
Once ur inside the museum is pretty big with 4 stories. Currently, the 3rd floor is closed. 1st floor and 4th floor has temporary exhibition, so i believe they often update new one. But the main highlight was Pablo Picasso, Guernica' famous painting at 2nd floor room no.205. You can also find Dali painting as well. Most of the people are on the 2nd floor. Rest its pretty much contemporary arts and paintings, which my wife is not a big fan of it. At some points, yes, it is hard to understand and appreciate the beauty, although the 19th/20th century artists do express themselves.
Overall, it was good to see at least one famous Picasso painting. The building layout is a bit confusing, though. Since it was free, it was not bad. Spend 1 and half.

I had an amazing time at the Museo Nacional Centro de Arte! The collection is vast and impressive, featuring stunning pieces of art that left me in awe. The variety of works, from classic to contemporary, is truly remarkable. What I loved most was the ability to search their online collection, making it easy to explore and revisit my favorites. The atmosphere was inspiring, and the staff were welcoming. Highly recommend for any art lover

places.address: C. de Sta. Isabel, 52, Centro, 28012 Madrid, Spain

places.generalDescription: Jard√≠n El Capricho de la Alameda de Osuna, also known as "The Whim," is a stunning 18th-century garden located in the district of Barajas. Spanning 14 hectares, this romantic masterpiece features an artificial river, lakes, woods, and various architectural wonders such as temples. Commissioned by the Duke and Duchess of Osuna in 1780, it reflects their enlightened taste and support for the arts.

sources.snippet: It was created by Mar√≠a Josefa Pimentel, Duchess of Osuna (1752-1834) on her estate in Alameda de Osuna, outside the city of Madrid. It is landscaped in the 18th century style with formal and naturalistic features and it is recognized as one of the most beautiful parks in the city. The landscape design shows some English influence such as continental gardens, and there are a number of "showy" ones such as a hermit's house.
sources.shortName: Best romantic places in Madrid

places.name: Jard√≠n del Capricho

reviews.text: Gorgeous park, really worth it even if it's a little far from the center. Recommend for a romantic afternoon walk, just gorgeous and many surprises all around the park. Forget about the map and just wander around, you'll find beautiful details all around.

Very beautiful place,,natural views, clean, quite, and absolutely attractive.
Their behavior was awesome,
It was raining and they gave us an umbrella ü•∞.
Thanks everyone ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è

This has got to be one of my all time favorite parks.  From the immaculate landscaping to the lush natural beauty and history, it's truly like walking around a fairy tale.  They don't allow dogs which makes sense since leash laws are either non applicable or un-enforced in Madrid and there are lots of landmarks and monuments in the park.  It's a great spot for a stroll or romantic outing. Highly recommend.

places.address: P.¬∫ de la Alameda de Osuna, 25, Barajas, 28042 Madrid, Spain

places.generalDescription: Riyadh Air Metropolitano Stadium, home to Atletico Madrid, is a must-visit for football fans and event-goers alike. Whether you're exploring the rich history of the club in its interactive museum or walking through the players' tunnel, this stadium offers an immersive experience. The seating is spacious and comfortable, ensuring you can enjoy events without feeling cramped. With excellent facilities and cleanliness throughout, your visit will be enjoyable from start to finish.

sources.snippet: Do not miss a visit to one of the city‚Äôs temples of sport, such as the Bernab√©u Tour where you can discover the refurbishments to the stadium with its embracing, unique and avant-garde image or the Riyadh Air Metropolitano Stadium Tour. And for a romantic but healthy meal, try the growing number of green restaurants and grocery shops in town like Honest Greens, Rawcoco, Kiki Market or Caf√© Run Run Run.
sources.shortName: Unique romantic getaways | Official tourism website

places.name: Riyadh Air Metropolitano

reviews.text:
Relatively easy to reach the stadium.
Very organized enternce.
I have attended a concert, and it excellent experience- Sound was good, the crowed sing along was very impressive due to the acoustics.
Seems like from every angle it was made sure the audience will be able to enjoy the show.
Clean restrooms.

We went there for the Straykids concert and were impressed by how well everything was organised. The waiting time to get inside was much shorter than anticipated because we stood in a couple of lines for each entrance. Security and bag check were also super fast, and once inside, the seats, bathroom, etc were easy to find. The concert itself was awesome and unforgettable! Thank you Straykids and Madrid for this beautiful experience ‚ù§Ô∏è

We went to the Metropolitano nights tour of the museum and stadium. It was an amazing experience to see the museum, dressing room, vip box and be so close to the pitch. They even had a lights show every 30 mins.

places.address: Av. de Luis Aragon√©s, 4, San Blas-Canillejas, 28022 Madrid, Spain

places.generalDescription: The Sorolla Museum, located in the Chamberi district of Madrid, is a serene retreat that was once the home and studio of the renowned 20th-century painter Joaqu√≠n Sorolla. This museum stands out for seamlessly integrating the artist's life and work by transforming his former residence into an exhibition space. Visitors can explore various rooms adorned with Sorolla's paintings while also admiring the museum's beautiful gardens.

sources.snippet: Just off of Castellana is the Sorolla Museum, located in the restored home of the 20th-century impressionist painter of the same name. It‚Äôs home to a large collection of Sorolla‚Äôs breathtaking Mediterranean-inspired paintings, as well as a quaint and beautifully detailed garden. It‚Äôs the perfect place to take a break with your loved one while celebrating Valentine‚Äôs Day in Madrid.
sources.shortName: Romantic Things to Do for Valentine‚Äôs Day in Madrid

sources.snippet: Other examples of museums not to be missed in Madrid are: the Thyssen-Bornemisza Museum, the Reina Sof√≠a National Art Center Museum, the Sorolla Museum, among other fascinating art spaces.
sources.siteName: Living Tours - Tours and Activities in Portugal and Spain
sources.shortName: Romantic things to do in Madrid for Couples, 2024

places.name: Sorolla Museum

reviews.text:
Sorolla family house in the centre of Madrid, very well preserved. The kitchen is the most authentic room in the house, it is as it was during the days when the Sorolla family used it.
The gardens are pretty, refreshing and calming.
They have master classes which seemed really interesting!
Hurry to visit, they are closing for reconstructions in September 2024.

Nice view, but not to much to see. The ticket cost 3 euro per person. Two girls that were in the staff saw that we were strangers and not Spanish and they looked suspicious at us. In 20 seconds, one came at us to tell us to don't touch the exhibited pieces and to out the bag in the luggage container. After this, she told us that is more to visit and that there we will have the tickets checked. For me, this seems discrimination. Horrible behavior! This is why I gave you 3 stars. For the exhibition only.

I really liked this museum. It was free the day we visited (normally admission is about 3 euros). There is a small quiet indoor courtyard with a fountain and flowers. Indoors, you can see many different paintings done by the artist, as well as some sculptures and even the artist's last painting supplies. There is a small gift shop with prints, magnets, etc. based on his paintings.

places.address: P.¬∫ del Gral. Mart√≠nez Campos, 37, Chamber√≠, 28010 Madrid, Spain

places.generalDescription: The Temple of Debod in Madrid is an ancient Egyptian temple that was relocated from Aswan and reconstructed in a picturesque park. It is over 2,000 years old and is the oldest monument in the city. Situated near Parque del Oeste, it offers stunning sunset views from its gardens, making it a favorite spot for both locals and visitors. The temple's interior can be accessed before sunset, as it closes after dark.

sources.snippet: The best sunset in Madrid is found at the Temple of Debod, a short walk away from Plaza de Espa√±a and the Barcel√≥ Torre de Madrid hotel . The temple, donated to Spain by the Egyptian government, is surrounded by gardens and palm trees, forming an exotic environment right in the heart of the city. Many couples use it for their wedding photos and it‚Äôs not hard to see why.
sources.shortName: Things to do in Madrid for couples

sources.snippet: Famous for its incomparable artistic wealth, Madrid is a paradise for lovers of culture and art. There are countless museums and art galleries throughout the city that you won't want to miss with your partner.
sources.siteName: Living Tours - Tours and Activities in Portugal and Spain
sources.shortName: Romantic things to do in Madrid for Couples, 2024

sources.snippet: From a sunset walk by the Temple of Debod to a dinner with a city view, Madrid has everything for an unforgettable date!. ‚ù§Ô∏è #RomanticMadrid #RomanticPlansInMadrid
sources.shortName: Romantic plans in Madrid - Visit Madrid

sources.snippet: Well, Debod Temple makes it easy for you‚Ä¶ Visit this gorgeous two thousand year temple. Do not miss the sunset in this park ‚Äìmind-blowing!
sources.shortName: | Espa√±a Fascinante

sources.snippet: If you‚Äôve already searched where to see a sunset with your partner in Madrid, you‚Äôve probably seen the Templo de Debod on most pages.
sources.shortName: Couples plans in Madrid
Romantic Things to do in Madrid: Top Experiences for Couples

places.name: Temple of Debod

reviews.text: Weekend so park was very busy but the Temple was not since tickets are required. They are free and I was able to get them well in advance. Not very big but still pretty cool. Contrary to what others have said, guards and employees were very nice. Note that the sunset doesn't line up in May which is what we went for. Still a very nice park with a great view.

This temple is one of the most overrated places I've seen. There's barely any information around. Apparently, there used to be reflecting pools on both sides, but they're gone now. I had to look it up online because it didn't feel like a historical site at all. As far as I can tell, only a small part of it is original - it's been heavily restored. I think its fame is mostly due to a bandwagon effect. The surrounding park is much nicer - ideal for walking and relaxing. To enter, you have to scan the QR code shown in the picture and wait about 20 minutes. They only allow 15 people inside at a time. I didn't go in, and honestly, I wasn't that curious.

The temple from Egypt has been placed here and when I went through the Google pics, that was looking amazing. There is a pond in there and the temples been placed into the centre, but I went there there was no water in the pond and it wasn't looking like the google suggested pics. Yes I saw the place and a pretty park is around the temple. Nice place to sit and relax, you will definitely have a thoughtful day.

places.address: C. de Ferraz, 1, Moncloa - Aravaca, 28008 Madrid, Spain

places.generalDescription: Gran V√≠a is a famous street in Madrid known for its stunning early-1900s architecture, bustling retail stores, and vibrant restaurants and bars. Often referred to as Madrid's Broadway, it offers an array of live performances, shows, comedy, and music near the nearby Plaza del Callao. Visitors can enjoy quality entertainment from national and international acts at little to no cost. The street is also home to numerous shops, affordable bars, and restaurants.

sources.shortName: A Romantic Couple‚Äôs Guide To Madrid

sources.snippet: Take a romantic stroll down this iconic street, lined with theatres, shops and restaurants. The vibrant atmosphere and neon lights create a unique setting for the occasion.
sources.shortName: Romance in Madrid: Romantic Places and Activities

places.name: Gran V√≠a

reviews.text: One of the best streets in Madrid. Amazing architecture all around, top brand outlets, restaurants, casino, all great vibes. A must visit area in Madrid. We came here around 4pm and the place was buzzing and all lively even then. Do visit! I recommend
Lively and fun! Enjoyed visiting this place where you find almost everything from food, clothes and luxury. Recommended to visit
Amazing place to shop and stay. Such a lively place.

places.address: Centro, Madrid, Spain

places.generalDescription: The National Archaeological Museum is a stunning neoclassical gem that showcases an extensive array of artifacts, ranging from prehistoric treasures to Islamic pottery. Established under the royal decree of Queen Isabella II, this museum underwent a significant renovation and now stands proudly next to the national library. Visitors can explore captivating collections that highlight ancient Greek and Roman life, as well as pre-historic items from the Iberian Peninsula.

sources.snippet: And if you love all things retro, head to the Teatro Real opera house, which is also home to the restaurant Papagena offering impressive views of the Plaza de Oriente and the Royal Palace; the National Archaeological Museum, which has been renovated recently; or the lesser-known yet equally amazing National Museum of Anthropology. You can also stop off at the Mirador de la Cornisa Viewpoint at the Royal Palace to take a beautiful photo of the stunning views over Campo del Moro Park and Casa de Campo Park.
sources.shortName: Unique romantic getaways | Official tourism website

places.name: National Archaeological Museum

reviews.text: This is a remarkable museum which is very well organized with some amazing and beautiful exhibits.  This runs through the evolution of modern humans, to prehistory, to some early civilizations, to Egyptian, Greek, Roman, and European Midieval civilization.  This does have an Iberian and generally Western orientation, and seemed to show little about, for instance, Persian or Far Eastern/Asian civilizations.  The cost is minimal.  The facility is very clean and was not crowded during our visit.

This museum was the highlight of our trip! The entrance ticket was only 3 euros, which we couldn't believe how cheap it was! The collection were across multiple floors, you could easily spend hour here. The collection were curated very well, they were all very interesting and the presentation was good. The staff was also lovely.

I recommend coming when the museum has just opened, you can mostly look around in your own peace.

This museum is huge! Lots of exhibition items and they grouped them by time in the different floors. In addition to revealing the history of Spain, there are Roman mosaics, ancient Egypt, Liberian peninsula.
Regular ticket 3 euros. Free admission on Saturday afternoon and Sunday.

places.address: C. de Serrano, 13, Salamanca, 28001 Madrid, Spain

places.generalDescription: Matadero Madrid is a cultural center located in the former municipal slaughterhouse of Madrid. The complex consists of 48 buildings, some of which have been restored and repurposed into spaces for various artistic and participatory activities. Visitors can explore the neo-Mudejar style architecture while enjoying exhibitions, performances, cinema screenings, and markets. The center features dedicated spaces for music, performing arts, literature, and non-fiction films.

sources.snippet: Another option is to visit MAD (Madrid Digital Arts) Immersive Experience Centre, a new space located in Matadero Madrid, a revolutionary centre for digital cultural development, unique in Spain and Europe. A creative space that experiments with immersion based on audiovisual projections, augmented reality, virtual reality, and holography to create a new relationship between art and society.
sources.shortName: Unique romantic getaways | Official tourism website

places.name: Matadero Madrid

reviews.text: really beautiful place, An excellent example of industrial recovery. Lots of well-managed spaces that can be used for a variety of purposes. Easily accessible

The old Madrid slaughterhouse, now repurposed as a cultural and artistic hub, sits on the edge of the Rio Manzanares. Once a center of industry, it has been transformed into a sprawling complex that attracts visitors from all walks of life. The area is now a vibrant space, with galleries, performance venues, and creative workshops filling the former industrial buildings. The atmosphere is a mix of history and modernity, offering a unique glimpse into Madrid's past while embracing its cultural evolution.

The nearby "Madrid Rio" Park has played a significant role in the revitalization of the neighborhood. Once an industrial wasteland, it now provides a lush green space for locals and tourists alike. The park stretches along the river, offering walking paths, playgrounds, and areas for recreation. It has brought new life to the area, making it a popular spot for both relaxation and outdoor activities.

This transformation has had a positive impact on the entire neighborhood, changing its character and making it an attractive destination. The old slaughterhouse and the surrounding area are now a testament to how Madrid has embraced its past while looking forward to the future.

Visiting this cultural hub is worth the time, not just once but multiple times. Whether you're exploring the galleries, walking through the park, or simply taking in the views of the river, there's always something new to discover.
Great place to combine the art lunch (nice exhibitions) with siesta outside. (Have a picnic in Madrid Rio). Muy muy recomendable.

places.address: Pl. de Legazpi, 8, Arganzuela, 28045 Madrid, Spain

places.generalDescription: Teatro Real, also known as El Real, is a prestigious opera house in central Madrid near the Palacio Real. Established in 1850 and extensively remodeled in the late 20th century, it offers a grand design with an auditorium that seats around 1,740 people. The venue hosts an impressive program of its own and international productions, classical music concerts, and dance performances.

sources.snippet: And if you love all things retro, head to the Teatro Real opera house, which is also home to the restaurant Papagena offering impressive views of the Plaza de Oriente and the Royal Palace; the National Archaeological Museum, which has been renovated recently; or the lesser-known yet equally amazing National Museum of Anthropology. You can also stop off at the Mirador de la Cornisa Viewpoint at the Royal Palace to take a beautiful photo of the stunning views over Campo del Moro Park and Casa de Campo Park.
sources.shortName: Unique romantic getaways | Official tourism website

sources.snippet: This place showcases a wonderful architecture, a plethora of stunning floral and green spaces, and lays out a true emphasis on food and wine. There are so many romantic things to do in Madrid that it‚Äôs definitely a great place to visit by couples!
sources.shortName: Romantic Things To Do In Madrid Spain On And Off The Beaten Path!

sources.snippet: Why not have date night on the road with an evening at one of Europe‚Äôs great theaters?. The 1,746 capacity theater known as El Real (‚ÄòThe Royal‚Äô) plays host to home productions involving leaders of international singing, stage, and dance.
sources.shortName: 9 Things to do in Madrid for Couples
Romantic Things to do in Madrid: Top Experiences for Couples

places.name: Teatro Real

reviews.text: I took the guided tour in English and I am very happy that I did so. Inside the building is quite big. Not only the  stage and seating area are beautiful, also there are multiple rooms designed like that of a palace. Our guide Arturo is a very kind person and explained everything well. Although we were a small group, the tour took longer than planned with the questions answered. Taking photos inside is restricted.

It is very nice opera house, and important one on the world's operatic map. Casts are usually very good, and producers like stage and music directors are always better than average. Theatre is modern, accessible for disabled. Ushers & people serving directly to public are nice, friendly and helpful. I had a bad side seat, and I moved to better section. While I was waiting for last moment to take an empty seat, no one was bothering me (not like in Vienna - where to do such switch would be like almost a crime...)

Wow, wow, WOW! The building is very well managed, very nice. Seats are comfy, sound was great! I saw la traviata and it was worth it!
You have to buy ticket in advance

places.address: Pl. de Isabel II, s/n, Centro, 28013 Madrid, Spain

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the western part of Madrid, Casa de Campo is a sprawling park that once served as a royal hunting ground. Spanning an impressive 1,722.6 hectares, it offers a serene escape from the city's hustle and bustle. With its gentle hills, meandering streams, and picturesque boating lake, it's perfect for leisurely strolls or invigorating runs.

sources.snippet: If you enjoy a more active lifestyle hire two bicycles and take a hide through the wonderful parkland in Casa de Campo. Cycle through the trees and enjoy the peace and quiet in the natural surroundings.
sources.siteName: Seeking the Spanish Sun - Spain travel blog
sources.shortName: Romantic things to do in Madrid - Seeking the Spanish Sun

places.name: Casa de Campo

reviews.text:
Casa de Campo (translating to country house in Spanish) is a large public park located to the west of the historic centre of Madri. The park is over 1,700 hectares in size and is the largest park in Madrid.

The park was originally a royal hunting estate and was created by King Philip II in the 16th century - from which the park gets its name. The estate was originally used primarily by Spanish royalty for leisure and was only opened to the public in 1931. This was due to the transition of Spain from a monarchy to a new Republican government which aimed to modernize Spain and break from class privilege and divide.

Today the park features some spacious and beautiful forests and gardens and rolling hills, it is a great spot to take a break from busy city life and go for a walk. Due to the quantity of hills there are a lot of points from which visitors can appreciate panoramic views to the rest of the park and even back over to the city skyline. There are a lot of cycling options available too including a covered cycleway. There are other curiosities to find in the park too such as remaining Spanish Civil War bunkers and the Valdeza Aqueduct.

Lago (lake) is a great spot for a picnic or for eating at one of the several lakeside cafes and is a nice entry point to visit the park. Metro access is available by the Lago station on line 10 of the Madrid Metro. Casa de Campo also boasts the Madrid Parque de Atracciones and the Zoo Aquarium de Madrid.

It's a lovely place and lots of green, but unfortunately it's a place that doesn't give women, children and adults the best feeling of security because there are no street lights at all in large parts of it, I as an adult man felt relatively fine, but I'm sure it's a place that can't give the majority of the population a pleasant feeling at night, what's more It's dangerous to walk almost only by moonlight, get ready for flashlights starting at 6 in the evening because there isn't even a drop of light that isn't from the moon.
A massive park in Madrid. Great place to relax, eat or take a stroll (or a long walk) through the parks. We walked a quick 3km from one train station to the next through the park.

places.address: P.¬∫ de la Prta del √Ångel, 1, 28011 Madrid, Spain

places.generalDescription: C√≠rculo de Bellas Artes is a renowned arts and cultural center in Madrid, offering a variety of attractions. The 1920s skyscraper boasts a rooftop terrace with stunning views of the city, including notable landmarks like Gran Via and the Metropolis building. Visitors can enjoy drinks at the rooftop cafe while taking in the panoramic scenery.

sources.snippet: Seeing the fiery orange and pink hues as the sun goes down from the Templo de Debod or the C√≠rculo de Bellas Artes will reignite the fire in your own relationship.
sources.shortName: A Romantic Couple‚Äôs Guide To Madrid

sources.snippet: A romantic respite from busy streets, Madrid's rooftop bars are an ideal way to ease from day into night. One of the most popular lookouts is the Fine Arts Circle, which offers a 360-degree view of the city. NH Collection Madrid Gran Via hotel also boasts an aerie, and if you can tear yourselves away from the views, wi-fi is free.
sources.shortName: The 9 Most Romantic Things to Do in Madrid

sources.snippet: One of the finest views in Madrid is from the rooftop of the C√≠rculo de Bellas Artes. The terrace of the iconic building boasts a gastro‚Äìcultural space where you can while away the night after dark. It offers 360 degree views from a height of 56 metres.
sources.shortName: Things to do in Madrid for couples

sources.snippet: This multidisciplinary cultural organisation puts on activities regarding the visual arts, film, poetry, stage, music, literature, science, philosophy and more. The iconic building constructed in 1926 has some of the best views in the city.
sources.shortName: 9 Things to do in Madrid for Couples

places.name: C√≠rculo de Bellas Artes

reviews.text: Best to go a little early if you want a place in the evening. There is a queue but it's not too bad. The Sunset experience is great. This historic rooftop bar is one of the best in Madrid !!

Beautiful terraza. The rooftop is at the top of a theater and venue. Pay ‚Ç¨5.50 to enter. The drinks are not expensive. Hard to find a table to sit at first, but we found seating when a group left. Worth it.

We really enjoyed our visit overall. The exhibitions didn't particularly capture our interest, but of course that's a matter of personal taste. What we found especially nice was the space on the 3rd floor, where you can relax in hammocks, play chess, or simply escape the heat. And the Martini terrace is absolutely wonderful ‚Äì with its incredible view of the city, it's the perfect spot to stretch out on a comfortable sofa and enjoy a glass of Martini.

places.address: C. Alcal√°, 42, Centro, 28014 Madrid, Spain

places.generalDescription: The Sabatini Garden is a neoclassical garden located within the grounds of the Royal Palace in Madrid, Spain. It features three terraces adorned with fountains, statues, and hosts outdoor events. The gardens offer magnificent views at any time but are especially spectacular at dusk, making it a romantic spot to catch the sunset. Opened to the public in 1978, these symmetrical geometric gardens boast a large rectangular pool, marble statues, graceful fountains, and shady trees.

sources.snippet: Next to the Royal Palace, these glorious gardens will not let you down. Loose yourself with your loved one through its labyrinths while you can also enjoy an amazing view of the palace. It is also a unique place to admire the sunset.
sources.shortName: | Espa√±a Fascinante

sources.snippet: There are also other natural spaces that are worth visiting with your partner, such as the Sabatini Gardens, Campo del Moro, Capricho Park, the Royal Palace Gardens, among other fascinating places.
sources.siteName: Living Tours - Tours and Activities in Portugal and Spain
sources.shortName: Romantic things to do in Madrid for Couples, 2024
Romantic Things to do in Madrid: Top Experiences for Couples

places.name: Sabatini Garden

reviews.text:
The whole area is great for walking as it isn't a huge place but still pretty sizable. There's a couple small fountains all around (some didn't seem to be operating though), a pond in the middle of the garden, statues surrounding the whole area (up the stairs, around the pond, etc) but suprisingly not a ton of flowers around and more just bushes and trees. The whole area does seem well taken care of as well.

There's also stairs surrounding the garden that you'll either have to go down to reach the garden or up after looking around but is definitely worth taking time to take pictures or selfies as it's a very nice view from atop. There are a ton of other attractions around as well such as Plaza de Espa√±a, Templo de Debod, Palacio Real de Madrid, Puerta de San Vicente, and way more worth seeing.
With the green of Spring, the gardens are a must visit in Madrid perfect for hours of walking and relaxing

Beautiful area to explore.

It is partially shut at the moment for reconstruction but the walk around it was delightful.

There was a few locals playing instruments at the centre and it was lovely to sit and listen.

places.address: C. de Bail√©n, 2, Centro, 28013 Madrid, Spain

places.generalDescription: The Flamenco Essential Flamenco Show takes place in a historic brick cave in Madrid, offering an intimate and authentic experience. The venue's century-old acoustics eliminate the need for microphones and amplifiers, enhancing the traditional flamenco performance. The tablao's Andalusian murals, wooden arches, polychrome tiles, and impressive columns create a captivating ambiance for the audience.

sources.snippet: Experience the passion of flamenco in one of Madrid‚Äôs tablaos. This Spanish art form is an intense and emotional experience that can add a passionate note to your Valentine‚Äôs Day.
sources.shortName: Romance in Madrid: Romantic Places and Activities

sources.snippet: Flamenco is Spain‚Äôs iconic dance, and watching the chemistry between the Flamenco dancers is sure to ignite the chemistry between you and your partner.
sources.shortName: 22 Most Romantic Things to do in Madrid [2024]
Romantic Things to do in Madrid: Top Experiences for Couples

places.name: Flamenco Essential Flamenco Show

reviews.text:
Truly an amazing experience! The show is extremely lively and is extremely impressive! From the flamenco dancer to the instrumentalists, everyone seems to have a deep understanding of their craft and it shows through the performance! I would recommend arriving at least 15-10 minutes before to get your free drink of choice and as well as having a higher chance of getting seats facing directly opposite the stage rather than having a side view. The cave is located downstairs which you will be lead to by the staff.  After everyone is seated, the show starts on the dot and a staff member will explain the history of Flamenco both in English and Spanish. Then the performances begin with solo performances and group performances interchangeably. The show goes on for an hour and it truly is a wonder to watch! Although it may not be for everyone as some parts can be repetitive or not as interesting, I do recommend seeing this show if you are interested in live performances and the arts in general!

My personal favorite performer when I watched was the female flamenco dancer. She has to be aware and in control of the movement of the dress, her facial expressions, her hands, her feet, her shoes, and especially her balance throughout her performance. Seeing it all together is truly a wonder!

I attended a flamenco performance at Essential Flamenco while visiting Madrid, and while there were certainly elements that stood out, the overall experience wasn't quite what I had hoped for. The venue is extremely cozy, which some may find charming, but be prepared for very limited personal space-seating is quite tight and up close.

The show included a complimentary drink, and I opted for the sangria. It was refreshing, a nice touch to start the evening. As for the performance itself, the musicians were talented and clearly passionate, but the pacing of the show felt a bit drawn out to me. About halfway through, I found my attention starting to drift. It may have simply been a matter of personal taste, as many others in the audience appeared fully engaged and enthusiastic.

If you're curious about flamenco and appreciate an up-close setting, this could still be worth checking out. Just keep in mind that the experience leans traditional and may not captivate everyone from start to finish.

I feel so privileged to have just seen this performance. I was completely overwhelmed at how good the evening was from the welcome drink on arrival to the actual show . The authenticity of the performance,the quality of the  costumes, their rhythm, energy, strength and physical stamina of the dancers blew me away! The whole troupe are so talented and I loved how they were so engaged with each other , obviously enjoying it too and being so proud of the efforts of the other dancers and the singer who was brilliant. I found their  joyful energy really moving and uplifting. This was a wonderful end to my stay in Madrid and it will truly be a night I will always remember ! Thank you .

places.address: C. de la Cruz, 26, Centro, 28012 Madrid, Spain

places.generalDescription: The Rosaleda del Parque del Oeste is a serene and colorful oasis nestled in the heart of Madrid. Established in 1958, this garden features hundreds of vibrant rose varieties, small ponds, and well-maintained footpaths. It has become a popular spot for locals to enjoy leisurely strolls, picnics, and recreational activities such as frisbee and football. Once a landfill site, it has been transformed into a stunning display of roses with botanical significance.

sources.snippet: La Rosaleda de Madrid enjoys a privileged location within Parque Oeste, one of the most important green spaces in the city. It is open every day of the year with free admission and does not require a reservation. It is in the heart of Madrid, very close to the Pr√≠ncipe P√≠o station in the Plaza de Espa√±a, the Temple of Debod, and the cable car.
sources.shortName: Best romantic places in Madrid

places.name: Rosaleda del Parque del Oeste

reviews.text:
One of the most peaceful places in Madrid. For enthusiast which like flowers, you need to go to this spot. The park is very well maintained with an astonishing amount of different roses and some other flowers. A must go!

Its also strongly recommended for everyone who wants to enjoy a more calm environment then the busy city. You will find a wonderful retreat.

There are plenty of park benches and with a good book you can enjoy life, luck and good spirits.
A sunny afternoon stroll in this beautiful park with friends is always a treat. There are so many new blooms to admire ‚Äì üå∏üå∑üå∫üåº

We visited here as we had seen the signs for the Rose Expo.  Some of the roses were past their best but the displays were still fabulous.  The park was free to enter and well looked after and it was lovely to stroll around and enjoy the flowers.

places.address: C. de la Rosaleda, s/n, Moncloa - Aravaca, 28008 Madrid, Spain

places.generalDescription: Sobrino de Bot√≠n, located just off Madrid's Plaza Mayor, is a historic restaurant that has been serving diners since at least 1725. It holds the title of the oldest restaurant in the world according to Guinness World Records. The dining rooms are decorated in an austere Castilian style and have welcomed notable figures from arts and politics.

sources.snippet: Bot√≠n Restaurant: Share a meal at the world‚Äôs oldest restaurant, famous for its roast suckling pig and intimate atmosphere in its historic wine cellar.
sources.shortName: Romantic Things to do in Madrid: Top Experiences for Couples

places.name: Sobrino de Bot√≠n

reviews.text: We planned a stop in Madrid just to visit this restaurant. I made reservations a year in advance, and it was so worth it! The service experience was top-notch from beginning to end. Our main goal was to try the succulent pig, and it didn't disappoint. (Simply delicious) I also recommend the sangria and the garlic shrimp. The calamari was not our favorite. We have had better, but it's just our opinion. Our server, Paco, was amazing. A genuine person! I strongly recommend this restaurant if you ever visit Madrid.

An unforgettable experience at the world's oldest restaurant! We ordered the suckling pig and roast lamb, and both were absolutely incredible, perfectly cooked, tender, and full of flavor. The skin on the suckling pig was crisp, and the meat just melted in our mouths. The atmosphere is cozy and historic, making the whole experience even more special. Service was excellent and attentive. Definitely worth a visit when in Madrid!

If I could, I'd award this restaurant six stars. Steeped in 300 years of history, this Madrid institution is a must-visit, and I highly recommend diving into its fascinating story before you go. From the moment you step inside, the old-world charm envelops you, blending elegance with a warm, welcoming atmosphere that feels like a step back in time.
The service is nothing short of fine dining excellence. Our waiter was attentive, friendly, and made the experience feel personal yet polished. Menus are available in English if needed, ensuring accessibility without sacrificing authenticity. The atmosphere is further enhanced by the delightful dioramas displayed in the restaurant's windows-whimsical and intriguing, they add a unique touch to the experience.
Now, the food. The garlic soup with egg and ham was a revelation-rich, flavorful, and so satisfying that I'm already craving it again. The cod was impeccably fresh, cooked to perfection with a delicate balance of textures and flavors. But the star of the show, as this restaurant is renowned for, is the suckling pig. The meat was melt-in-your-mouth tender, bursting with flavor, and crowned with perfectly crisp skin that's worth the visit alone. For dessert, the cheesecake was divine-creamy, indulgent, and the ideal finale to an unforgettable meal.
Don't miss the wine cellar downstairs, a treasure trove housing vintages older than your great-grandmother, adding to the restaurant's storied allure. This is more than a meal; it's a cultural and culinary experience that you simply cannot skip while in Madrid. Book a table, soak in the history, and savor every bite-you won't regret it.

places.address: C. de Cuchilleros, 17, Centro, 28005 Madrid, Spain

places.generalDescription: The Cine Dor√© is an old movie theater in Madrid that specializes in classic and new films. It is home to the Filmoteca Espanola, a ministry of culture institution that restores and preserves old films. This cinema has been featured in a few Pedro Almodovar movies. It's always open and offers great value for your money - just 2.50 a ticket!

sources.snippet: You may recognise this classic 50 year old cinema from a few Almodovar films. Cinefiles will love the round the clock screenings of classic, world cinema, and experimental productions. You also won‚Äôt find a better value night out in all of Madrid: just ‚Ç¨2.50 a ticket.
sources.shortName: 9 Things to do in Madrid for Couples

places.name: Cine Dor√©

reviews.text: Really special cinema. We liked watching old movie in old cinema. No food or drinks allowed inside. Box office opens 17:00 h. I think it is 3e for entering. We saw a movie for free I think because it was a film festival. 2/3 of tickets they sell online 1/3 is left for box office.

The Cine Dor√©, the oldest cinema in Spain, is a beautiful venue with two screening spaces and a cosy cafeteria, which hosts all kinds of films -old and modern- and film seasons at very affordable prices. Tickets can be purchased online (up to 5 days before the screening) or before the screening (they always keep 1/3 of the tickets for sale on the spot). Sometimes the screenings also include a presentation or a talk with some members of the film crew after the screening. Foreign language screenings (non-Spanish) are always shown in O.V. with Spanish subtitles.

Exactly 4 min late for 5:30 movie, and i was not let in. I pleaded but The lady had rude behaviour. What is it? Do you want me to enjoy the theatre or just want to have your 5 min of satisfaction playing authority?

places.address: C. de Sta. Isabel, 3, Centro, 28012 Madrid, Spain

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the charming Barrio de las Letras, Bodega de los Secretos is a hidden gem that transports diners back to the 1600s. This enchanting restaurant, set within an ancient wine cellar, boasts intimate brick-lined alcoves perfect for romantic dinners. The menu features a delightful array of elevated Mediterranean dishes with modern twists, including succulent Pyrenean steak and innovative ceviche infused with tropical flavors.

sources.snippet: Delve into the neighbourhood of Las Letras to visit an underground restaurant that is as romantic and intimate as it is unique. Warm lights, 17th century vaults and corners perfect for a close conversation. This old wine cellar not only offers you shelter in the heart of Madrid, but also brings the best of national and international cuisine to the table.
sources.shortName: Most romantic restaurants in Madrid 2025

sources.snippet: Bodega de los Secretos, hidden in Madrid‚Äôs Literary Quarter, is a 400-year-old labyrinth of galleries, caves and wine nooks‚Äîperfect for a candlelit dinner for two. Another excellent option is Caripen Bistro, a late-night dining spot with an air of 1920s Parisian-inspired glamour.
sources.shortName: Romantic Things to Do for Valentine‚Äôs Day in Madrid

places.name: Bodega de los Secretos

reviews.text: Such an awesome experience in this 1600s wine cellar turned bomb shelter turned restaurant. Service was impeccable- fast and attentive. All of our food was so delicious. We were worried it would be a gimmicky spot considering the atmosphere, but the food was truly delicious. I can not recommend the oxtail enough

It was a fascinating experience dining at Bodega de los Secretos. Not only were the dishes impressive, the service was also excellent. The male manager in black glasses was friendly by offering a nice table despite my late booking. As a couple travelling to celebrate our wedding anniversary, we were truly amazed by how observant and thoughtful the restaurant was. Would definitely recommend it!

Great place for a special dinner with a unique setting underground.
amazing atmosphere.
The meat was perfectly cooked, juicy, and full of flavor. I also loved the croquetas, especially the jam√≥n ones crispy outside, creamy inside.

places.address: Calle de San Blas, 4, Centro, 28014 Madrid, Spain

places.generalDescription: Campo del Moro Park is a historic garden located on 20 acres with steep slopes, streams, paths, and trees. The park features two monumental fountains and is inspired by the royal gardens of England. Its name translates to 'The Field of the Moor,' referencing the Moors' historical attempt to capture Madrid in the 12th century. Visitors can experience a sprawling English estate atmosphere while exploring this expansive space.

sources.snippet: There are also other natural spaces that are worth visiting with your partner, such as the Sabatini Gardens, Campo del Moro, Capricho Park, the Royal Palace Gardens, among other fascinating places.
sources.siteName: Living Tours - Tours and Activities in Portugal and Spain
sources.shortName: Romantic things to do in Madrid for Couples, 2024

places.name: Campo del Moro

reviews.text: Love this park. If you're looking for a little escape from the heat, this place is perfect.

We saw a peacock expanding its feathers and this is a common thing for them and a reaction when they feels threatened or trying to mate during the season. Plenty of walking paths and feeling of being surrounded and submerged into the nature. Also there is a restaurant at the entrance via paseo de la Virgen del Puerto
Perfect location to alleviate the Madrid heat. Lots of tree canopies provide as much shade as you're going to get in the middle of Madrid. Some hidden curiosities along the perimeter trails‚Ä¶

places.address: P.¬∫ de la Virgen del Puerto, 1, Centro, 28013 Madrid, Spain

places.generalDescription: Linares Palace, located in the Plaza de Cibeles, is a historic 19th-century palace with an ornate interior and a rich history. Built as the residence of the Marquises of Linares, it is now home to Casa de America and hosts various exhibitions and events. The palace is shrouded in mystery and ghost stories, adding to its allure. Guided tours are available on weekends, offering insights into the palace's history and legends.

sources.snippet: Another option is to visit the Marquis of Linares Palace, headquarters of Casa de Am√©rica, which organises a night-time visit as if it were the 19th century, with characters from the period as hosts who will reveal the palace's most hidden and mysterious secrets. Furthermore, legend has it that the Marquises of Linares and their daughter Raimunda had a stormy existence and their ghosts wander around the family palace amidst complaints and cries.
sources.shortName: Unique romantic getaways | Official tourism website

places.name: Linares Palace

reviews.text:
Beautiful place of interest!
You should visit with excursion ü§ù
More photos via instagram @vladislavkarpyuk

Can you guess the reason? üéâ ‚öΩÔ∏è üëë
Of course it's football, (soccer).
Not a Real Madrid fan, but the atmosphere was fully indulgent, nevertheless.
The city was on fire! #RealMadrid #HalaMadrid
This is a venue most tourists in Madrid probably skip, but it was worth doing. It's a guided tour but as near as I can tell is only in Spanish. The palace is beautiful. No photos allowed.

places.address: Plaza Cibeles, s/n, Salamanca, 28014 Madrid, Spain

places.generalDescription: Hammam Al √Åndalus is a luxurious thermal spa in Madrid, offering ornate bathing areas and massages with essential oils and hot stone beds. The Arabic baths feature hot, tepid, and cold pools, a Turkish steam room, an aromatic relaxation room, and massage rooms surrounded by Arabic architecture. The converted cellars house traditional Arab baths with a water circuit taking visitors through different temperature pools.

sources.snippet: Discover the charm of traditional Arab baths at a hammam in Madrid. Immerse yourself in thermal pools and enjoy massages in an atmosphere that evokes another era. It‚Äôs the perfect place to relax as a couple and surround yourselves with tranquility and romance.
sources.shortName: Romantic plans in Madrid - Visit Madrid

sources.snippet: Get slapped down on a hot stone table, lathered up in a soap and red grape mixture, and let a masseuse scrub you down with a Kessa glove before  massaging you to sleep with essential moisturizing oils. This Arabic bath joint won‚Äôt disappoint!
sources.shortName: 9 Things to do in Madrid for Couples

sources.snippet: Hammam Al √Åndalus, located in the heart of Madrid, the perfect spot that offers a traditional Arab-style spa experience. Head over to their website to see all that they offer, it‚Äôs the real deal.
sources.shortName: Romantic Things To Do In Madrid

sources.snippet: In a serene setting in Madrid, the experience of an Al √Åndalus Hammam Bath becomes an intimate retreat for couples.
sources.siteName: Living Tours - Tours and Activities in Portugal and Spain
sources.shortName: Romantic things to do in Madrid for Couples, 2024

places.name: Hammam Al √Åndalus Madrid Plaza Mayor

reviews.text: OMG we had the best time!! Felt like an old world dream. Staff explained each step. Clean well appointed facilities. Staff were friendly & professional. Book today!!

Overall a relaxing experience, but room for improvement.
The spa offers a warm bath, hot bath, cold bath, steam room, and showers-all of which contribute to a calming atmosphere. However, the facilities are quite outdated and could use some renovations. The dressing rooms are also cramped, which takes away from the comfort. While I enjoyed the visit, it felt a bit overpriced given the current condition of the amenities.

I stumbled upon this place during my travels through Spain. And all I can say is that I'm still day dreaming about this place. I highly recommend checking it out. It was an incredibly relaxing and a wonderful, immersive experience. I would 100% travel back to Madrid just to enjoy this spa/bath again. If you can, I would recommend ending your session with a massage. It was the cherry on top to an already wonderful time.

places.address: C. de Atocha, 14, Centro, 28012 Madrid, Spain

places.generalDescription: Madrid R√≠o is a popular urban park in Madrid, Spain. It offers a variety of activities and attractions for visitors to enjoy. The park features beautiful green spaces, walking and cycling paths, playgrounds, and sports facilities. Visitors can also find cultural attractions such as art installations and outdoor performances. Additionally, Madrid R√≠o provides stunning views of the city's architecture and bridges along the Manzanares River.

sources.snippet: The new area around the Manzanares river boasts a green zone that is perfect for an afternoon spent with your partner on a pleasant bike ride. The southern portion is fairly flat and straight and perfect for an easy ride, whilst the part towards Pr√≠ncipe P√≠o and Matadero Madrid is steeper and busier. Stop level with the Matadero and cross the bridge so you can recharge your batteries at one of its terraces, or head to the Segovia bridge at sundown where you can see the Royal Palace and the La Almudena Cathedral all lit up.
sources.shortName: Things to do in Madrid for couples

sources.snippet: Madrid R√≠o: Take a peaceful walk along this modern park, stopping at the urban beaches and artistic bridges. Consider visiting during golden hour for spectacular photo opportunities.
sources.shortName: Romantic Things to do in Madrid: Top Experiences for Couples

places.name: Arganzuela Park

reviews.text: Beautiful park. I walked around in it for a couple hours and still didn't see all of it. There were people and dogs everywhere - running, biking, roller skating, everything. Still didn't feel overcrowded. That big futuristic bridge was super cool too.
Decent little park. Nothing outstanding or special, but it's nice to have a little greenery to walk your dogs and kids
Beautiful views, great park and great atmosphere. Lots of things and activities to do as well as relax and enjoy.

places.address: P.¬∫ de las Yeser√≠as, Arganzuela, 28005 Madrid, Spain

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the heart of Madrid, Corral de la Morer√≠a stands as a testament to the rich cultural tapestry of Spain, blending exquisite culinary artistry with mesmerizing flamenco performances. Since its inception in 1956, this iconic venue has earned its reputation as the oldest and most celebrated flamenco tablao globally. It has welcomed an array of A-list celebrities like Nicole Kidman and Harrison Ford, who have come to experience its enchanting atmosphere.

sources.snippet: Nowadays you can watch a good flamenco show in many coffees and bars in Madrid, one of the most emblematic of which is undoubtedly the Corral de la Morer√≠a.
sources.siteName: Living Tours - Tours and Activities in Portugal and Spain
sources.shortName: Romantic things to do in Madrid for Couples, 2024

sources.snippet: Or, if you want to be extra, you can take a Flamenco lesson at the Amor de Dios Flamenco School and learn to dance the traditional Andalusian style.
sources.shortName: Romantic Things To Do In Madrid

places.name: Corral de la Morer√≠a

reviews.text:
Great food, great service. Show was a little late to start, but well worth the wait! Amazing skill and intensity.

It wouldn't be worth just getting the show-only ticket - paying for dinner puts you in the area right in front of the stage.

Food was excellent - we had the Sole√† (entry level) menu and the vegan menu. Both really good, especially the salmon main course on the Sole√† menu - a generous portion, lightly cooked to perfection.

Good service and advice on the wine - didn't push for a stupidly more expensive bottle.

Overall, would not recommend. For the minimum price ‚Ç¨100 for show and dinner per person we expected much better. The entree (‚Äúliquid salad‚Äù) was the worst thing I can remember eating. We got put on the side wing right down the back. I spent the evening with the corner of a table in my chest. Could barely see anything between all the tables in front and waiters and children constantly walking back and forth. Of what we could see was the backs of the dancers, but sounded nice. The couple next to us complained and got better seats - not offered for us. The couple who got put next to us got sick of the bad food and not being able to see anything and left half way. Cherry on the top - not asking for bread and being charged for it.

Excellent show in terms of the music/singing/dancing. The artists were all amazing. Location is great. Drinks were okay. I would stick with wine. In terms of how the seating is they could do a better job. You only get a front view of the show if u do dinner with show. If you are only watching the show then it is a side view and a lot of neck straining. Also pillar blocking view.

places.address: Calle de la Morer√≠a, 17, Centro, 28005 Madrid, Spain

places.generalDescription: Ram√≥n Freixa Madrid is a renowned fine dining restaurant located in the Salamanca district of Madrid. The restaurant, led by Catalan chef Ram√≥n Freixa, has been awarded two Michelin stars and three Repsol Suns for its innovative approach to traditional Spanish cuisine. The menu at Ram√≥n Freixa Madrid is carefully curated to showcase seasonal ingredients, featuring dishes such as cured monkfish, Charolais beef wellington, and Majorcan sausage.

sources.snippet: If you want to take your date night up a notch up in Madrid, why not sign up for a cooking class?. Cooking together is an incredibly intimate and romantic experience that will bring you closer together.
sources.shortName: Romantic Things To Do In Madrid

sources.siteName: Living Tours - Tours and Activities in Portugal and Spain
sources.shortName: Romantic things to do in Madrid for Couples, 2024

places.name: Ram√≥n Freixa Madrid

reviews.text: Outstanding food and service, and the wine pairing was exactly right. This is clearly a top notch restaurant, but even within the category, this ranks at the top. The discovering menu is a good balance between diversity of options and amount of food. The bread basket had plenty of choice and they were all great. The service was great.

We came here for lunch to have one of the prix-fix menus available. It was truly a one of a kind experience. All of the staff who work here are well trained and skilled professionals. The service is impeccable and sets the bar for all other dining experiences we have attended.

The food was a a very memorable journey. Each dish leaves you with a different impression as your culinary experience weaves from one to the next. I recommend coming with an open mind and no preconceptions on what to expect.

Come here to take your time enjoying the story of the food, the quality of the hospitality, and the passion that is on display from all those who contribute to the entire experience.

This is the worst Michelin I've ever been to.

The food is just gross, they look gorgeous however. The services are great too. But the food is just either not fresh or has a dozen weird flavors in one dish, a few of which are too salty. The wine pairings are smart but not paired‚Ä¶

places.address: C. de Claudio Coello, 67, Salamanca, 28001 Madrid, Spain
